intro: Devauxia drummondiana, commonly known as Drummond's devauxia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Due to its adaptations to harsh conditions, it plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local wildlife.
